title: alani123
author: alani123
content: This is something I've always been wondering about. Gamblers tend to have a league, be it basketball football or any famed sport, that they tend to love most. For instance in the USA American football and NBA betting tend to be very popular, while in south and south east Asia countries cricket is also very popular among other sports. So people tend to have a league in a certain sport that they know the most about, have a favorite team in, know the players etc. So what's your experience with this. When your league is in break, do you tend to try to follow other leagues that you're familiar with, or will you gamble on anything really? I'm interested to hear what other people have to say in this matter. For me personally, I try to limit my gambling to teams where I know at least some players, because otherwise it's easy to get carried away. Really in my opinion, gambling on leagues and sports that you know little to nothing about, only increases the edge against you.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: In sport, I prefer football the most. If you are a gambler and checking the livescores sites, you will see that there are many leagues and all of them do not begin and can not finish their seasons at once. Just like those like EPL, Bundesliga, Ligue 1, Seria A, and some other ones may finish at once, but there are still many other leagues that you can continue to use for betting. Football is played is all through the year. I have favorite leagues to choose from all through the year.

comments.author: Stepstowealth
comments.body: Quote from: alani123 on November 16, 2023, 09:55:47 PMSo what's your experience with this. When your league is in break, do you tend to try to follow other leagues that you're familiar with, or will you gamble on anything really? I'm interested to hear what other people have to say in this matter. As leagues go on break for the players to rest, the break is also for gamblers to rest too. When your favorite league to bet on is on break, you can take that time as a time to rest and steer clear from gambling. You do not need to gamble always or have alternative games to gamble on, there should be times when you give yourself a break so you do not become too addicted to gambling that you lose control of yourself. These break times in leagues is an opportunity for that.

comments.author: temple
comments.body: This is really a good question because maybe some have advice or suggestions to share here, but betting on anything I have no clue about is no real alternative for me. I usually wait until that break is over, but since I like a lot of different kinds of sports there is rarely a time where there is nothing to bet on. I think when you are interested in football, tennis, basketball and some other sport like racing, there are opportunities for good and fun bets pretty much year round. But if there is nothing to really bet on and I want to have a good time, there is also stuff like poker or a round of blackjack. I would not make my biggest bets on sports that I like less as I rather save that for games I can watch and enjoy and also know a lot about. Maybe reducing the bets is a good suggestion to still have some fun, but hold back with the really exciting bets when the betting options are back to normal.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Well end of the season is a resting time for most football lovers most especially this is because at that point, they will still have the chance to follow up with other activities that may keep them busy until the league resumes again and that is what most of the other sports lovers may be doing also before resumption. Although is also very hard to see a gambler who only loves one line of games,  some of them are fans of multiple games and leagues,  and for they are always engaged and no dull moment for them as long as the season and breaks are concerned because while maybe football leagues are on break he continues with the NBA,  or Tennis etc,  that is how they go through the year making sure that they keep their engagement at all time.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: Quote from: alani123 on November 16, 2023, 09:55:47 PM~I follow other leagues. Though tbf, most of them are actually after another. or conflict most of the time. During those times, I usually just bet on whatever I think I'd enjoy, I still watch the vods though if I have time but I only vote on the ones I watch live. Especially if you consider how there's some new team unknown to me at some matches, can't help but lose interest by then. I usually enjoy matches with players I know after all. It is kind of dumb to bet on a sport you don't know about though, that's literally one of the important factors that separate sports gambling from plain gambling. A factor that you can see and derive how it can influence the match, and thereby make a bet based on that. If you don't know jack and start betting, might as well just play dice really.

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: Personally, I go for basketball games when my football league is on break. But, it's mainly a non technical kind of gambling. A type that doesn't require me to do enough analysis before betting. Because, due to my region, basketball isn't famous like soccer. So, I don't watch the game often. But, loves staking games on it, just for the fun. Instead of not gambling at all. Even most times, I still don't watch the game after betting on it, because I'm mainly used to watching football. Unless a big basket ball team wants to play. Seeing basketball stars play is always fun, the trills and magic they perform with the ball is quite memorable. I don't think that I'll ever look elsewhere in sports gambling, except these two games. Additionally, I feel relaxed watching basketball, as the teams are not emotionally attached to me. That's any team that wins I'm good. Never going to bother about it, like in football. Where I'd always want the team I bet to win and when they don't, I get a bit worried. This happens because I'd feel that my analysis on football game isn't improving.

comments.body: I always switch to leagues that keep me entertained like esports and NFL, which are usually scheduled on the weekends, and a bit of basketball in between. comments.body: I'd gamble with anything but that's also the time to learn some new sports that I am interested in, like I'm not in F1 but I'm still learning about it. comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: If the NBA is in season break, I go for the WNBA which is already starting while the Finals is still happening in the NBA. Then, I also focus on boxing and MMA fights as these are some of the sports that I love while growing up. Also, there's the Olympics and the FIBA that I am looking forward to watching whenever those sports are on break. It's a good thing that both those events also happen during the NBA break or I think it was made for that purpose so both events won't collide. There are so many sports that can be watched and bet on. Boxing matches for example are done weekly on weekends and so do MMA so as long as you know something about the game you won't get that rest because the weekdays will be used to analyze what the results could be and that's also to enhance our chance of winning.
